title: Divergence Theorem Applications: Medium Level
description: Answer all questions. Each carries 1 mark. Choose the most appropriate option.

questions.title: For the vector field $\vec{A} = \frac{5r^{2}}{4} \hat{r}$, the divergence $\vec{\nabla} ⋅ \vec{A}$ in spherical coordinates is:
The Divergence Theorem relates:
options: Line integral of a vector field to the surface integral
Volume integral of divergence to the surface integral of the field
Surface integral of curl to the line integral
Gradient of a scalar to the flux

questions.title: In the region $1 \le r \le 2$ and $0 \le \theta \le \pi/4$, the volume element in spherical coordinates is:
For a purely radial vector field $\vec{A} = A_r(r) \hat{r}$, the flux through a spherical surface depends only on:
options: The angular part of the vector field
The value of $A_r$ at the boundary surface
